website_summaries.verdict: Specially designed for flexibility and portability, this product is ideal for those who currently have hand weights or dumbbells but want the lifting flexibility a kettlebell provides.
pros: Lightweight 1-pound harness holds most standard dumbbells up to 55 pounds
You can use your own hand weights or those belonging to any gym
We really like the lifetime warranty, which is a rare offering
Weights are secure and do not slip once in the grip
cons: The item sold is only the grip itself
it doesn't come with weights or dumbbells
Handle may be too slick for those used to cast iron

customer_reviews.title: Great concept, doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I was quite excited to have a way to do kettlebells on the road. Unfortunately, I have yet to find a set of dumbbells that have a small enough hand grip to fit in the kettle gryp. I've tried three different styles, but all hand grips on the dumbbells I encounter in my travels are larger than will fit in the kettle gryp. Great concept, but turns out to be useless. Buyer beware, this is definitely money down the drain. Here's hoping someone else will run with the idea and create a version that works!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Surprised how well it worked!
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit skeptical of this product, but I was pleasantly surprised! It worked well with my dumbells. Basically, I wanted to do the kettlebell swing. Since my dumbells are adjustable, I can adjust weight as well. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: TonyC

customer_reviews.title: Can only be use for certain dumbbell
customer_reviews.text: This is a warning for this attachment. This can only be used for a metal dumbbell that has a narrow handhold. I have a neoprene dumbbell so this attachment did not work. They really should have put this information on the page so let anyone/everyone know that this attachment cannot be used on neoprene dumbbells.
customer_reviews.author: Teri

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing...
customer_reviews.text: This item is a great idea but... unlike how it’s advertised it does NOT fit most dumbbells. The company says it fits Bowflex 552 Adjustable Dumbbells, it does NOT (see my unboxing video) If one cant believe what the manufacturer and customers say about this product, how can anyone make a truly informed decision to buy? In an effort to keep the item, the photos above show, I tried it on the other dumbbells I own - it doesn’t even work with generic 3 & 5 lb dumbbells from Target. It’s cheaper to buy regular kettle bells so I’m returning this item.
customer_reviews.author: calexg

customer_reviews.title: Great piece of cost-effective equipment
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent piece of equipment. I use it with a 35 lb dumbbell and it fits snugly and securely around the handle. I have no problem controlling the weight and it also makes it easier for my family to move the weight around when I leave it where it someplace in the way. Considering what the cost of a new, or even used, 35 lb kettlebell would be, this is a great alternative. Plus, if I decide to go up in weight, I can buy a dumbbell instead of a kettlebell and save money. It also turns one piece of equipment into two. There are no cons that I have experienced or observed.
customer_reviews.author: FreeFriFriddlyFrum

customer_reviews.title: the Kettle gryp is well built for the money and allows you to perform the exercises like Kettlebell swing without any issues
customer_reviews.text: Ok, the Kettle gryp is well built for the money and allows you to perform the exercises like Kettlebell swing without any issues, however it creates problem with "clean and clear" and other moves that required kettlebell (in your case - dumbbell) to touch the body. I used it with Bowflex SelectTech 1090 () but , as I said , returned and decided to take normal 45 lb kettlebell.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Won’t fit on dumbbells
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately the Kettle Gryp would not fit on the dumbbells I own (CAP rubber). They also don’t fit on the bowflex 552’s which is misleading from the product pictures. Great idea but need to have different options available for different size dumbbells.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Richins

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I'm using the Kettle Gryp on my spare Powerblock Elite handle. I had to remove one side of the handle to slide on the Kettle Gryp, but works perfectly. Now anytime I want to use kettlebells, I remove the original Powerblock handle, insert this one, and good to go.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to love this!
customer_reviews.text: The whole point was to use the dumbbells I have, but this will not fit around the grip of my dumbbells or any at my gym. Hope they come out with a larger size.
customer_reviews.author: lovetoshoponline

customer_reviews.title: Great. But the next version could include this improvement.
customer_reviews.text: I love it. It allows me to do squats with my barbells without my hands hurting. My only issues that I wish I could switch the orientation of the bar so the handle would stay the same, but the barbell would be perpendicular to me. This would allow me to do exercises with my feet closer together, without the fear of slamming the barbell into a knee. Other than that I love it. I live the grip, the color. I love orange. And it’s very easy to open and put on another barbell. Seems sturdy enough to last a long time. I especially love that it’s USA-made. I look for products made in America. This is a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Grossman

customer_reviews.title: Solid Piece of Workout Equipment
customer_reviews.text: It works great for some things. Not so great for other. I can't do heavy KB swings because of the width of the dumbbell. My stance has to be almost at Sumo width so that I don't hit myself with the dumbbell on inner thighs. Despite this shortcoming, I have bought 2 of these gadgets. I love them for my farmer carry workouts. Works great with 50lbs DB's to do farmer carries. Would be 5 stars if someone could have engineered a piece that can be turned 90 degrees at the bottom portion so that the dumbbell passes "vertically" between legs.
customer_reviews.author: Vineta

customer_reviews.title: It turned my "10-90lb Bowflex Select Tech dumbells" into 10-90lb select tech kettlebells!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great value item! It turned my "10-90lb Bowflex Select Tech dumbells" into 10-90lb select tech kettlebells! I'll admit, it's a pretty WIDE kettlebell even at it's lightest weight. But for the price, I love it. The only exercise I can't do well are "figure 8s". Who cares if I can do everything else? I am a large guy though at 6'3". Not sure about a smaller stature person. I have been using it daily for about a month. I'm sure you can't beat on these and drop them. But you can't meathead around the "select techs" either.
customer_reviews.author: MMArk

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what it says it does.  Perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: This thing works flawlessly. I only gave it 3 stars for value because $30 seems like a lot for a piece of plastic. But its a good piece of plastic that holds the barbell securely. The only downsides are the ones that are impossible to fix compared to a real kettlebell. The resulting combination of this handle and a barbel is much taller than a kettlebell. So if you are doing anything like a Clean, it will flop back. Its hard to do a clean smoothly. Also, the resulting combination of this handle and your dumbbell is wider than a kettlebell. So if you keep the bell up high when doing swings, you may need to Sumo out more.
customer_reviews.author: D. Mei

customer_reviews.title: Good concept. Terrible Execution
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a cool concept, but the handle didn't grip my adjustable dumbells how I would've like it to. The dumbell would move from side to side when doing swings. The only move you can do with this grip is swings, I tried doing kb squats and couldn't grip it comfortably. If they had included some grips to make sure it fit snuggly I would've kept it instead of returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Edwardo Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Versatile???
customer_reviews.text: The description claims the Kettle Gryp "fits most" dumbbells. I tried 4 different dumbbells and the handle didn't fit any of them . . . not even close! It's a wonderful concept with the potential to save you from having to buy multiple kettlebells. I gave 1 star for versatility because it didn't prove to be versatile for me.
customer_reviews.author: Lars Fischer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty slick design and a great way to expand your gym equipment with a single purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to make all my smaller dumbbells into in kettle-bells. I am used to using heavy 53, 70, 80lb KB, but found some shoulder mobility exercises and new movements that require less than 53lbs. This thing works well as an adapter for cast 15, 20, 25, 30, 35, 40lb dumbells. Saved me from having to buy a bunch more iron. The handle grip is a good size for my large hands, a bit wider than a competition kettle-bell. Very sturdy, great locking mechanism and made in the USA. The only thing this don't work with are oversize handles on dumbbells, like the foam coated cast ones, their too big.
customer_reviews.author: G.H.

customer_reviews.title: Expand your workout equipment!
customer_reviews.text: I received it on Wednesday, this week. I have tried it out briefly, only twice. This weekend I will utilize this as part of a longer workout. It appears to be an excellent idea, that is why I purchased the Kettly Gryp. I have limited space and try to "use what I have" when it comes to workout tools.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: Weight Set Upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I already had a number of cast iron dumbbells and wanted to get the benefits of the kettlebell. This is a nice compromise when you've already got the weights on hand. Considering its plastic construction, the Gryp is solidly built and holds your bell securely. I feel like the handle design makes the combination of Gryp and DBell a little long and wide, but I can make adjustments in my movements to compensate. Works great for when I'm traveling and have access to a hotel weight room. The Gryp takes no room in your luggage.
customer_reviews.author: Fujio

customer_reviews.title: Great gym investment
customer_reviews.text: I love these handles. Haven't had them very long so I can't comment on how well they hold up. They are fast and easy to get on and off. I'm not a big kettle bell fanatic, but I use them regularly for a few things and they're much better than dumb bells on those. So a pair of these doubles the versatility of my dumb bell rack. Sometimes little things can make a big difference. Assuming they don't suddenly fall apart tomorrow, they're one of my smarter gym investments. At this point, I wouldn't hesitate to recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Adrian Crown, Maitre d'Armes

customer_reviews.title: A good concept, but...
customer_reviews.text: The idea of converting your dumbbells into kettlebells is a good one, but the versatility of this product is very limited. The manufacturer claims their Kettle Gryp will accept dumbbell handles up to 1.5 inches in diameter. This is true only if you remove the rigid foam inserts, which are bonded in. With the inserts in place, the Kettle Gryp will only work for handle diameters up to about 1-1/8 inch. So if you have coated dumbbells, e.g., neoprene or vinyl, the Kettle Gryp will not work unless you permanently remove the foam inserts, and even then coated dumbbells may still not fit. For those of you with CAP style dumbbells with uncoated steel handles, Kettle Gryp will probably work.
customer_reviews.author: RDKar

customer_reviews.title: Could Use Improvement
customer_reviews.text: No good for vinyl covered concrete dumbells, the shaft length and girth ratios mean it won't fit any size weight. The latch and hinge don't fill me with confidence in thier durability, this is the kind of plastic that can fracture into sharp edges/shards, and the handle seam placement combined with the so-so latch can pinch *hard* when used with heavier weights that make the unit flex. Needs re-engineering. Should be better quality for the price point. Will wait to return so I can compare it to a different brand/style I ordered.
customer_reviews.author: keygirlTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: 100% worth it, saves space and made in USA
customer_reviews.text: I ordered one on amazon and it fits onto my 15’s and 20’s super easily. It makes lifting easier on my wrists for squats and lunges. I didn’t want to buy a bunch of kettle bells that would just take up more room since I already have every sets of weights from 5 to 25, the kettle gryp is exactly what I needed. Open it feels slightly light and “will this hold this” but once you close it it holds tight, no sliding or wiggling and it feels strong. I wish it had a softer handle but it’s not life and death lol. I honestly really like this, plus made in the USA makes it even better!
customer_reviews.author: Brie

customer_reviews.title: Great product, adds versatility to my workouts without needing a full set of kettle bells!
customer_reviews.text: This is a quality built product, made in the USA. Very happy with the fit on the dumbbells I've used it on. The way it is built insures that there is virtually no seam on the grip when it is closed properly. Been using it for a couple months now, and it shows little to no signs of wear. Very happy with the product, will make a great gift for those friends and family that are into fitness.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Very good for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Loved this product. It does exactly what is says it dose. Strong plastic, good design. I use it with 50 lb weights all the time and heaver with out issue. Definatly a great buy if you have an assortment of dumbbells but dont want to purchase the exact same weights just in a different shape. The only thing I'd change is the handel, itz a bit to small for my hands. I can't fit two hands compleatly in the handel hold with out removing two fingers per hand. But for one armed workouts it is a thing of beauty. Well done.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Ricketts

customer_reviews.title: Kettlebells get expensive
customer_reviews.text: This is such an amazing addition to the gym. We have a large set of dumbbells and wanted to add kettlebells to the routine; however, they are rather pricey for just one. After browsing for some exercise equipment for the holidays, this item popped up and was pleasantly surprised. The material is a very sturdy plastic and the dumbbell locks in place so you don't risk it 'flying out' We are very happy with this gym addition and will be purchasing more in the future for gifts for our fellow gym friends.
customer_reviews.author: CMHWolf

customer_reviews.title: not for short folks
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use w/my husband's weights to do kettleball workouts, however, I am short, hovering slightly above 5 ft, so when I do squats , this hits the ground. Also, when I have to hold it one hand and stretch towards the ground, it feels dangerous, in that I feel like the dumbell will hit me in the face if I am not mindful. I guess the dumbell is too bulky for the kinds of workouts using kettlebells. I had to return it, which was no problem at all. Glad I gave it a shot.
customer_reviews.author: Old Bones

customer_reviews.title: Really Impressive Product
customer_reviews.text: These grips really exceeded my expectations. I already had a set of adjustable dumbbells with a variety of plates, so these kettle grips allow me to utilize those like traditional kettle bells. The dumbbell handle stays firm, and the grips are not slippery at all. It is very easy to put them on and take them off the dumbbells. Overall, these are straightforward and will save you a lot of money if you already have dumbbells, and are considering kettle bells. I couldn't be happier with these.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Fisch

customer_reviews.title: A great alternative to buying separate kettlebells!
customer_reviews.text: Bought one of these to allow my wife to do some kettlebell exercises with the iron hex dumbbells that we already have at the house. I found it to be well made and very secure when used with our standard hex dumbbells. Has held up to regular use, including removing/reattaching, for the better part of 3 months so far. A nice solution to avoid having to purchase yet another set of weights for the home gym (particularly during COVID when nothing is available for a reasonable price).
customer_reviews.author: J. Kowalski

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect, but I do recommend it very much
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe there aren't more products like these. Kettlebells are so expensive and they can be great, but they're not as versatile as dumbells. I use this on my Bowflex adjustable dumbells and it works, but it just takes a little more effort to snap it on. The grip seems to be indented especially for these types of dumbells, so that was nice. Despite being just plastic and foam rubber, it seems to be pretty sturdy so far. I do wish that the handle was one solid piece though. It wouldn't be a great departure from the current design and it would make the handle much more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Oshiro

customer_reviews.title: Great for home gym
customer_reviews.text: Love this for my home gym. Dumbbells are expensive and kettlebells are even more expensive, so I was intrigued when I saw this attachment. It's hard plastic and feels good in the hands, it's what I expected. It fits my CAP hex rubber dumbbells up to 30 lbs, I am waiting to get 35s and will test them on those as well. I use this grip to to kettlebell swings, squats, Romanian and straight-leg deadlifts, and other basic exercises. Happy with my purchase and glad I can use the dumbbells I already have.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren J.

customer_reviews.title: Worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I have been exercising with weights for a long while. Recently read a book, "Eat Bacon, Don't Jog" by Grant Petersen, where he extolled kettleball exercises. This thing (Kettle Gryp) allows you to convert a dumbbell to a kettleball . Positives: if you have a variable weight dumbbell you can experiment to get to the right weight, and this approach is less expensive; minus: this is clumsier than a regular kettleball, since the weight is spread out farther on a dumbbell. Anyway, I am happy with this and using it.
customer_reviews.author: J. D. Meyer

customer_reviews.title: No gym, no problem!
customer_reviews.text: I would definitely recommend this product for anyone, especially right now that no gyms are open! I only had a couple of sets of dumbbells as workout equipment and needed kettlebells to add in some good full-body workouts. As you probably know, all dumbbells and especially kettlebells are being overpriced at the moment. This handy invention solved the issue for me. It is really sturdy and feels like an actual kettlebell. Just as awesome is the fact that it fits all of my dumbbells!
customer_reviews.author: Rene Ayala

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to my barbells!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this gryp because I wanted to do kettle bell swings and already have a couple sets of barbells so why buy kettle bells when I can just buy this? It works GREAT for swings, not so great for some of the lifts where you're pushing up over your head, or maybe I just need to work on that some more (that's why I only gave it 4 stars). But I also have other weights I can do those exercises with. I am very glad I bought this as kb swings are a great workout! Thank you for an innovative, functional product!
customer_reviews.author: lbk

customer_reviews.title: Really inexpensive way to expand your home gym!
customer_reviews.text: So as the title says this is about the best way I have seen to really take your home gym to another level for under $40! instead of spending hundreds of $$$ on various kettle bells you can simply convert the dumbells you already have! I have used 3 different handle sizes and it works fine. The only thing I will say that's not ideal (really not the products fault) is once you start using heavier weights it becomes a bit clunky and awkward to use without taking an exaggerated leg width stance. Otherwise a good purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Fuzz414

customer_reviews.title: Durable and Economical
customer_reviews.text: It is very strong and durable. I did not have high expectations but it quickly put a smile on my face and changed my expectations once I used it. I have been looking for kettlebells but hard to come by during this pandemic. This is more economical than purchasing multiple kettlebells. I can use this with all of my free weights. I was surprised to see how durable this product was with my 20 lbs weights (in the pic).
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: Cool addition to a home gym
customer_reviews.text: This is a really neat idea. It should work for most any free weight. I have ones where the handle gets bigger in the middle than on the ends, so it's not even. This still works, because the inside of the grip is lined with a cushiony foam that allows for bigger weight handles. It snaps on quickly and allows you to have a range of kettle bells without having to buy them all in different sizes. Great addition to the stay-at-home gym!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer J

customer_reviews.title: Good addition to my exercise stuff.
customer_reviews.text: This kettlebell handle works perfectly with my dumbbells(Cap) with 1” diameter handles. Now I have the flexibility for different routines without investing in a complete set of kettlebells. The Kettle Gryp is made in USA. It feels solid and the handle is comfortable to hold. Overall it’s well designed.
customer_reviews.author: Walter W. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly sturdy, the feeling of the plastic gives a flimsy feel but everything is nice and secure once you put the locking mechanism in. Can replace a kettleble in a lot of exercises but you might still want a kettle bell for certain exercises, (like goblin squats) regardless I'm very satisfied overall with the product. One thing that I don't like very much is that there is no sort of grip on the handle. The plastic feels like it might slip out of your hands if your hands are sweaty, not a good feeling when you're swinging around a 40lb dumbell. I've remedied this myself with grip tape and weight lifting gloves but it's something to keep in mind.
customer_reviews.author: Gordito_Kawaii

customer_reviews.title: Only holds hand weights that have a 5" grip
customer_reviews.text: I think the idea of this grip is great, however standard hand weights with the soft foam only have a 4" spread and they doin not fit inside the kettle grip. I have one set of hand weights that have 5" spread and this is the only set I have that will work.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Levine

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I was a little skeptical when reading some mixed reviews but decided to try it anyhow considering that I own a full set of dumb bells but no kettle bells. Aside from needing to use a slightly wider stance when doing kettle bell swings I would say that this adapter works great, is comfortable to use and saves a lot of money not needing to buy kettle bells. I am sure that there are reasons to own and use kettle bells as this device and the dumb bell attached to it is larger than what a kettle bell would be, but for my use I would say it is great and gives a dual purpose to my dumb bells.
customer_reviews.author: John Ciardi

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, just a little off
customer_reviews.text: I want to love this more I really do. The idea is great, the application a little off. I’m 5’7” for reference. I feel like the distance from the handle to the dumbbell is just too long to truly mimic a kettlebell. For example doing a simple swing with this attacked, the weight almost drags to the ground. If it were just a bit shorter I think it would be much more useful. Otherwise snaps onto my Bowflex weight easily and functions as a KB handle.
customer_reviews.author: K. Babcock

customer_reviews.title: Makes working out on trips easier
customer_reviews.text: I've used it on several trips now. It works as advertised! The locking mechanism is very secure. My only complaint would be that the grip is too smooth. It makes some moves difficult. It would be great if the grip could have more friction.,
customer_reviews.author: BruceCH

customer_reviews.title: great purchase for temporary home gym
customer_reviews.text: I was not sure what to expect when I ordered this but it is a great addition to the home gym. It snaps on easily to the dumbbells I have and functions just like a kettlebell. The only downside is your legs may need to be a little farther apart than you're used to on KB swings as the DBs are longer/wider than a KB is... I'm satisfied with it and lets me add a KB to crossfit workouts at home.
customer_reviews.author: Drew Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent American-made product!
customer_reviews.text: Just about any kB exercise can be done with this adapter, though common sense notes you’ll need to be careful when doing kB swings due to the width of the dB swinging between one’s legs/knees. Extremely strong and durable... enclosed dB doesn’t slide around or spin: it stays put while you’re going through your motion. I use the kettle gryp with my bowflex selectteh 552 dumbbells. The entire assembly- dB and gryp- stays rock-hard and stable, just like a real cast iron kB. It’s perfect for me in my tiny apartment, since I have neither the space nor desire to bring more expensive equipment into my home.
customer_reviews.author: Jmp1nJakFl@sh

customer_reviews.title: Thick plastic and a stong lock make this a reassuring addition for my home gym.
customer_reviews.text: My wife bought this for me for Father's Day. It works great with my Wal-Mart weights. I have no fear of tossing this thing over my head with a 40lb weight. The clasp has a reassuring click when it locks in and the plastic is a night heavy ABS plastic. There are a pair of rubber inserts that grab onto the weight itself that look like they can be replaced when needed, which is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Rivera Family

customer_reviews.title: Best invention since Bow Flex
customer_reviews.text: I have the Bow Flex variable dumbbell weights and this attachment just added a whole new arsenal of works outs I can do at home. No reason to purchase kettle bell weights separately when you have this attachment to use. Kudos to the inventor as this item is a game changer for your home gym especially if you have limited space living in an apartment complex.
customer_reviews.author: URDUNSON

customer_reviews.title: Nice alternative when your gym doesn't have Kettlebells!
customer_reviews.text: I tried out a friend's Kettle Gryp and thought it was the coolest thing since sliced bread! Ordered mine immediately and it showed up the very next day! Re-incorporating kettlebell swings into my workout has been an added plus! (Despite the sore delts and glutes that result!). I'd recommend this device for anyone looking to take their fitness to the next level.
customer_reviews.author: WOW429

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for kettlebells but they are so hard to find right now, so I decided to give this a try. I was a little nervous the dumbbells would stick out to much to be able to do kettlebell swings, but it works great. Since equipment is so expensive it’s so great to only have to buy dumbbells, not kettlebells too. This is SO worth the money and converts one piece of equipment into two. I would highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Dante & Brittany

customer_reviews.title: A Useful Tool in My Quest For Fitness!
customer_reviews.text: I like the ease of making a dumbbell into a kettle bell. With that said, the position of your hands relative to where the dumbbell hangs is a tad too long to give the swing the same feel as an actual kettle bell. I’m not a pro gym rat or anything so I’m sure it is better than nothing. It just feels slightly different to me. I’m very happy with my purchase overall and love that I’m supporting a local San Diego company!
customer_reviews.author: idonotcook

customer_reviews.title: Smart buy for your home gym
customer_reviews.text: There’s no question that this is an excellent cost saving and space saving piece of equipment. The width of the handle feels smaller than a traditional kettlebell. When you combine that with the height of the apparatus itself, it’s makes bottoms up kettle bell presses especially difficult (so it’s a great way to work your shoulder stabilizers) My only “complaint” is that the handle could be a little more textured/sticky to help with grip when your hands inevitably get sweaty from your workout. It’s by no means slippery, but the plastic material isn't the easiest to hold onto either. I understand the challenge in doing this given how the device opens/separates at the handle itself but just food for thought
customer_reviews.author: Chris Bassler

customer_reviews.title: Better off buying a kettlebell
customer_reviews.text: Works great to turn a dumbbell into a kettlebell but the weights (just like the one shown) are too wide for me to comfortably use them as kettlebells for kettlebell swings. So defeats the purpose. I’m 5’ 7”.
customer_reviews.author: Anna G Marler

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Kettle Bell option with Covid reducing fitness equipment supplies everywhere!
customer_reviews.text: Read a review that mentioned this kettle bell option not working with some dumbbells. Covid has reduced training products across the board almost impossible to find so I gave it a shot. My experience is that it’s Perfect! Until I’m ready to purchase and I am able to find Kettle Bells again, this’ll work great!
customer_reviews.author: Rudy V. Fenner

customer_reviews.title: if dumbbell is to think you may need to adjust and then snap into close position
customer_reviews.text: used gold gym adjustable dumbbell set. it has an oval shaped grip and its thicker int he middle. i have to jiggle it sideways for it to fit closer together before i press close with force. worked well so far. Additional detail is that its hard plastic. sure it can hold the weight BUT id avoids dropping these things with anything heavy hitting it directly, no doubt itl break. Be careful is all
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Fits Bowflex Select Tech DB's 1090
customer_reviews.text: The originators of this style of product made it so that I can use it on my Bowflex Select Tech 1090's. I'd be willing to pay more if they just reinforced it so it's rated above 55lbs. There are so many more applications to this product beyond just kettlebell swings so the rating of 55lbs or less makes it limited.
customer_reviews.author: Cruiser

customer_reviews.title: Simple and durable.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty cool design weight doesnt move very much while in it. Made of sturdy plastic that looks cheap but, is quite durable, accidentally dropped (without a load on it) several times with no damage. Only complaint is when sweat hands go in it, it tends to slip due to the handle being made of the same material without any knurling (the diamond pattern on most weights) or any other grip assist.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great interim solution to convert weights to kettlebell!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great alternative to buying kettlebells if you already have a set of weights. So far it has held up alright, but I am worried about the plastic breaking sooner rather than later. Despite the photos showing this working with the bowflex adjustable weights, it is not an easy fit. It works great with the basic weights with the slim metal part, but I have to work at it to get the bowflex weights to fit and close. Then it's difficult to open back up as well. But overall still happy with it, and hope it holds up over time.
customer_reviews.author: Jonesey

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This is SO much better than having to buy individual kettle bells especially when you're on a budget. I already have dumbells and wanted some kettle bells for other exercises and a friend mentioned this to me and I'm super happy with this purchase. It's easy to grip. Easy to put on the dumbbell and it saves space on having to much gym equipment at home.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't fit Selectech 560
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't work with the Selectech 560 dumbbells, which is what I hoped for. I'm using it with an old free weight bar, which doesn't fit well. The plastic handgrip is ok. Not really what I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Bdub

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I was worried that the dumbbell would slip or that it would be awkward to use vs. regular kettlebells. Nope. Works great at a fraction of the cost of a kettlebell.
customer_reviews.author: T. J. Perkins

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Product!
customer_reviews.text: What a genius idea! I purchased this because I only have an 8 lb kettlebell and I wanted to increase my weights for KB workouts but also wanted a variety of weights. I was unsure if this would fit my adjustable dumbbell weights, but they do! Using this Kettle Gryp with my adjustable dumbbells has saved me a ton of money and space in my small workout area! Curious to see if the plastic will hold up over time. I’ll update if it breaks or anything, but so far I’m super excited for my purchase especially since it’s from my hometown of San Diego!
customer_reviews.author: Money

customer_reviews.title: Work well
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one of these I have purchased. I have had one for myself for over a year and bought this one for my son. They are great, turning a dumbbell into a kettlebell. My son will be using more than the 20 pounds I use so stay tuned for updates. We see a 55 lb limit so will follow the recommendations.
customer_reviews.author: michael donovan

customer_reviews.title: Clever contraption to enable home workouts in these days of covid-19
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to turn various dumbbell weights into kettlebells. It does fit around the 552 Bowflex dumbbell handle, although it is a very tight fit. It functions well enough for me to use while I can’t get to the gym. The heavier dumbbells get pretty big width-wise and so, the kettlebell they make is wider than an actual kettlebell would be. For my deadlifts, my legs needed to be further apart than they would be with an actual kettlebell. I can make this work but it is something to keep in mind. With all of these things in mind, I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: s. pivnick

customer_reviews.title: Awesome concept
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to receive the Kettle Gryp because I work out at the gym 5 days a week and it would be perfect for my workouts. When I took the Kettle Gryp to the gym I was totally bummed out! It did not fit onto the weights they supplied at my gym, it was to small. Unfortunately I will have to return.
customer_reviews.author: ABC School Equipment Inc

customer_reviews.title: One glaring issue...
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to really like this, but I just can't. The one glaring issue is that it cannot fit any sort of dumbbell that has the flared grip on the end. The flared grip make it impossible for this to get around the grip and secure itself. I've attached the issue in a photo. Otherwise, the item feels sturdy, yet extremely light and durable. I totally wanted to slap a bunch of stickers on this and get to swingin'. Sadly that won't be the case for me.
customer_reviews.author: W. Fong

customer_reviews.title: A brilliant product!
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had invented this product. It is extremely easy to use and I see no difference between this and actual kettle bells when I exercise. I love that the group is wider than most kettle bells on the market. My only recommendation is that they use a higher grade plastic in the future. Somehow it feels a little cheap but it performs like a champ!
customer_reviews.author: Maurice Dumit

customer_reviews.title: Not For Neoprene Style Dumbbells :(
customer_reviews.text: I was really looking forward to transforming my dumbbells into kettle bells; however, this innovative gadget does not work with the neoprene dumbbells. I am certain it is a great fit with standard dumbbells with the steel bars. I hope to find something just like this that will wrap around my neoprene set.
customer_reviews.author: FlyGirl

customer_reviews.title: Strong! Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical of this product at first but it has really proven to be a useful tool in my home gym! Kettlebells are expensive but this allows me to use the dumbbells that I have to progress certain movements. Great for swings, deadlifts, turkish get ups but not ideal for more intricate movements like halos.
customer_reviews.author: Chaley Morris

customer_reviews.title: Awesomely!!
customer_reviews.text: It’s very easy to work with. I love them. Since I don’t have any plates for my barbell y clamp the dumbbells in them and used then as plates. Easy to do Kettle bell swings !!!
customer_reviews.author: Martha Acosta

customer_reviews.title: I'd buy it again!
customer_reviews.text: I have a power tower (dips, pull-ups, knee-ups) and this is perfect to use for securing extra weight with my dip belt (also use for pull-ups). I have used 35 pound dumbbells with no sign that the kettle grip is distressed. I plan to go heavier with it In the future. Great product and saved my workouts in this current gym-less environment the gov has forced us into.
customer_reviews.author: Carver

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Bowflex Selecttech 552's!
customer_reviews.text: I got this in the hopes of being able to use it on my Selecttech 552's, and it worked out perfectly. The grip is extremely snug around the 552 handle, but I was still able to lock it into place. Not sure how long it is going to hold out, but for now it's perfect and allows me to have an adjustable kettlebell weight between 5 to 52.5 lbs. Not bad at all!
customer_reviews.author: Chris R.

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: I have Bowflex Select tech dumbbells and I wanted to do some kettlebell exercises so I bought this handle. It fits snug on a Bowflex dumbbell, but it does work on one. I use this from time to time to change up my routine when I want to add in some kettlebell exercises and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: This Gryp perfectly adjusted to my rubber Weider Dumbell set (10lb, 15lb, 20lb, 25lb & 30lb). It locked securely and easily fits in a gym bag. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Zenas

customer_reviews.title: Saved Money
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to do "some" kettle bell exercises just a few different moves. Instead of buying the kettle bells in different weights I bought two of these and I can easily use the dumb bells I have. These are well constructed and it is easy to swap out the dumb bells. Win. Win.
customer_reviews.author: Nbird

customer_reviews.title: Saves the cost of individual kettle bells
customer_reviews.text: Given the cost of individual kettle bells, the Kettle Gryp is a good alternative for many kettle bell exercises. It is a little bit bulkier than a normal kettle bell but it fits perfectly on my adjustable dumb bell set giving me up to the equivalent of a 50 pound kettle bell.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Great Idea Saves Money
customer_reviews.text: I really like this, as it is a great option for wanting to have kettle-bells but already have full weights set. Only reason I am giving this a 4 star and not a 5, is because it does not fit all bar bell weights sets. It requires a slimmers straight bar. All in all a great options.
customer_reviews.author: JF

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: This was an impulse purchase and it turned out to be a great addition my CrossFit equipment. Now all my dumbbells are kettle bells saves me so much
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Finally, a useful device
customer_reviews.text: Of all the fitness gadgets out there, here's one you can look at and say, "That's a great idea." Clamps tightly onto the weight (the dumbbell never moves, even when swinging it) and functions like a normal kettlebell. And, with this design, the weight doesn't bang into your arm if you're doing a shoulder press. Now, we'll see how long it lasts.
customer_reviews.author: M. Pavia

customer_reviews.title: Creative idea!
customer_reviews.text: This product is great. Sure, it is a little wide, because of the shape of a dumbell versus a traditional kettlebell... but you save TONS of money by using the Kettle Gryp with your existing dumbells! I have no issues with this fitting my dumbells 5lb - 60lb.
customer_reviews.author: Steed Travillian

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking to convert your dumbbells into Kettle-bells this does the trick. It's easy to use and works pretty well. Does it work as good as a kettle bell? No, of course not but it does get the job done. It just seems expensive for what you get. I mean for sure it is way cheaper than buying a set of Kettle-bells but really seems expensive for a piece of molded plastic. Still, great idea and I do not regret the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Edwin D

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy, and fits around bow flex adjustable weights!
customer_reviews.text: My partner and I are obsessed with this handle. We have the bow flex adjustable weights, and they fit perfect. We use it for dumbbell swings, upward rows, and so much more! My partner even hooks it around our pull up bar, and it is sturdy enough to hold his weight.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Amazing invention.
customer_reviews.text: I use this at work, where the fitness room has only one 15 pound kettlebell, but a variety of dumbbells up to 50 pounds. Changing weight is quick (less than 10 seconds) and easy. The handle is lightweight but strong; I've used a 50 pound dumbbell with it with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: D. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great Alternative
customer_reviews.text: It is a great alternative to the KB. Being a dumb bell, it is a little uncomfortable during squats as the length of the dumb bell makes you alter (widen) your stance. While the clasp is of sturdy construction, you can't drop it like a KB.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Howard

customer_reviews.title: Seems like a sturdy design
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a sturdy design. My son reports that it worked well, however he did experience some soreness after using it, primarily in the bicep region. I will re-post when I find the probable cause.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Evilhart

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't fit the weights I use....
customer_reviews.text: I just tried to use it at my gym and it's too small for the dumbbells there. Its basically useless to me unless there is a way to make it fit more than 1 size of dumbbells
customer_reviews.author: Mstripling86

customer_reviews.title: Versatile, minimalist gym setup
customer_reviews.text: Clamps on to my adjustable Bowflex dumbbells well. Now I have a set of dumbbells and kettlebells. Great for those who don’t know what weight kettlebell you need or if you’re looking for versatility and minimalist gym setup. The clamp feels sturdy and tight.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonUser88

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for travel!
customer_reviews.text: So far I really enjoy this product. I had a few dumbbells but no kettlebells and have started to do a few different squat exercises that really benefit from a kettlebell. This is a great way to convert dumbbells I already own into kettlebells. More importantly, the hotel I am currently staying at has a nice dumbbell selection but not a single kettlebell. VERY happy I threw this into my suitcase so I can keep up with my workout while on the road.
customer_reviews.author: A. Kolhoff

customer_reviews.title: Way to Big for Most People.
customer_reviews.text: The thinking behind this is great, however, it is way to big for most women or smaller men to use . The handle is so wide you can only do squats. Also, not a fan of this vendor. They make you pay for shipping to you and then if you return it, you have to pay the shipping back. Very expensive piece of plastic you can find in some stores for much cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: RMP

customer_reviews.title: Innovative product that saves you money
customer_reviews.text: I am an at home personal trainer that refuses to buy a bunch of heavy kettle bells. I have some 10-30lb dumbbells that I used these with and they are good so far. The weight does shift a little bit when you set the dumbbells down (causing them to be uneven) but that doesn't compromise the apparatus at all. I own two, and as my business grows I will most likely purchase another set.
customer_reviews.author: Alberto

customer_reviews.title: Great little device
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my home gym since I wanted to do more kettlebell workouts without ordering 50 and 60lbs balls of iron. It's a little bigger than I was expecting since a lot of kettlebell handles are sometimes single-hand sized. Pros: it wraps around both wide grip and regular grip dumbells, lightweight, easy to use. Cons: it feels a little too light and I worry it'll break when I'm flinging especially heavy weight. This hasn't happened, and I'm sure it's been tested so I'm not too worried. The handle shifts a little when you're gripping especially hard.
customer_reviews.author: Asparagustus

customer_reviews.title: It didn't fit my dumbells
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately it did not fit the dumbbells I have so it won't work at all. It's also rather large and clunky vs. a traditional kettlebell. I'd recommend saving your $$ and getting the actual kettlebell.
customer_reviews.author: cmh

customer_reviews.title: If you have dumbbells, this will save you hundreds of dollars on kettle bells
customer_reviews.text: This is really incredible. I was about to spend twice the amount for one kettlebell and this lets me use all my dumbbells- change over is very fast. My heaviest dumbbell is 50lb- I have no concern about the safety of this equipment. This is a wise purchase and a great cost savings.
customer_reviews.author: MCS

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: The device is very ergonomic and portable to carry around in my gym bag without adding any extra weight to it. It holds and stabilizes pretty heavy dumbbells which have definitely improved my workouts as most gyms typically don't posses kettle bells in heavier classes. So far it holds 130lbs just fine when I do KB swings. Definitely recommend this product and have gotten tons of questions about it at the gym, I'm seriously considering purchasing another one.
customer_reviews.author: ABAYOMI OLADIMEJI SELESI

customer_reviews.title: so very practical
customer_reviews.text: I was doing dumbbell swings and was really interested in trying kettlebell swings but was hesitant to invest in kettlebells since I already have dumbbells and I am short of space. Couldn't be happier with the Gryp. It has added a new dimension to my dumbbells and incrementally increased my investment. And I also love the fact that it is made in the USA which to me indicates a quality product. Thank you Andy Thomas for producing a quality and versatile product.
customer_reviews.author: Monica Matos

customer_reviews.title: This Kettle grip does work and probably works much better with conventional dumbells.
customer_reviews.text: I like this grip but it needs a larger diameter opening for my Nordic Track dumbells, and my Weider dumbells of which both are dial up types. I had to tak one side of the rubber grip inside the clamp part of the grip area just to clamp it shut and although it worked , was still too tight as I had trouble unlocking it. Otherwise, great addition. I’ll try taking both rubber inserts out and see if this works. But still .....
customer_reviews.author: Vlara

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality item
customer_reviews.text: It fits my adjustable weight bowflex weights and saved me money and space from having to buy additional kettle ball weights. It takes a little bit of time to adjust as this setup is a little wider than a regular kettle bell but it works fantastic overall.
customer_reviews.author: Cris Alamuri

customer_reviews.title: KBG's Rock!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a pair of these and these things feel like solid quality! They work with the dumbbells in my gym perfectly and they are absolutely perfect for adding variation to curls, tricep extensions, delt laterals, chest flies, Etc. No buyers remorse here.
customer_reviews.author: J Dub

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Much better than buying a new set of kettle weights and uses a small fraction of the space.
customer_reviews.author: Goof Daboof

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Fit my dumbbells perfectly. Use it for KB swings. If you want to use KBs occasionally and have a set of dumbbells and don't want to spend money on KBs this will work. If you're workouts are primarily KBs I wouldn't buy. They would be great to take with you if you travel. Handle is well made. I am happy with my purchase it suits my purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best addition to my home gym!
customer_reviews.text: This Gryp is amazing! It literally converted any of my dumbbells including my Bowflex Dial dumbbells into a Kettlebell. It is extremely easy to use - sturdy - comfortable and WELL worth every penny! I highly recommend this addition to your gym!
customer_reviews.author: MichelleC

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Way to Kettle Bell !
customer_reviews.text: Love this! Very sturdy and really does turn your barbell into a kettle bell ! Kettle bell swings here we come!! Doing virtual workouts now and this was the perfect way to turn any weight into a kettle bell versus trying to find different kettle bell weights. Just insert clock and kettle bell away!! Love!!
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Hohn

product_meta.title: Kettle Gryp - Kettlebell Adjustable Portable Weight Grip Travel Workout Equipment Gear for Gym Bag, Crossfit WOD, Weightlifting, Bodybuilding, Lose Weight | Clamps to Dumbbells | Made in U.S.A.
product_meta.description: Kettle Gryp is a portable dumbbell adapter that turns ordinary dumbbells into dynamic workouts. Perfect for the home gym, traveling fitness enthusiast, or trainer/gym owner with limited space; Kettle Gryp gives you a full kettlebell workout at a range of weights anywhere you can find a dumbbell. Kettle Gryp can accommodate most dumbbell handles that are at least 4.5" wide and up to 1.5" in diameter. For reference, the standard Olympic bar diameter is 1.1". Please see the Fitting Guide on our website for further details. Enjoy your Kettle Gryp workouts!
feature_bullets: ✅ IMAGINE NEVER HAVING TO MISS YOUR KETTLEBELL WORKOUT WHILE TRAVELING | Kettle Gryp is the perfect workout accessory for your travel needs, or to keep in your everyday gym bag. At less than 1lb, this device can hold most standard dumbells up to 55lbs and instantly turn it into a kettlebell.

✅ BUY NOW TO HAVE ONE OF THE MOST IMPORTANT ACCESSORIES IN YOUR WORKOUT BAG | Workout Gloves, Check. Lifting Straps, Check. Protein Shake, Check. KETTLE GRYP?! Check! This workout accessory will quickly become one of the go-to pieces of gear in your gym bag.
✅ ADD TO YOUR CART NOW TO HAVE THE NEWEST AND MOST INNOVATIVE PRODUCT IN KETTLEBELL TRAINING | Kettle Gryp is a Veteran American-Owned company that proudly manufactures in San Diego, California.

✅ CHECK OUT WITH CONFIDENCE | WE OFFER A LIFETIME WARRANTY! We LOVE our customers here at Kettle Gryp and you can buy with confidence with our lifetime warranty. If you’re not happy we will do whatever it takes to make sure you love your new Kettle Gryp.

✅ ACHIEVE YOUR FITNESS GOALS | For men or women who want to achieve their fitness goals working out at home, in the gym, or when traveling. Kettle Gryp is a light-weight, durable, and economical solution.
